definitions.text: the spirit of a dead person, sometimes represented as a pale, almost transparent image of that person that some people believe appears to people who are alive
examples: The gardens are said to be haunted by the ghost of a child who drowned in the river.

definitions.text: a memory, usually of something or someone bad
examples: The ghost of the old dictator still lingers on.

definitions.text: to write a book, article, etc. for another person to publish under their own name
examples: A writer friend of his was ghosting the autobiography of a jockey.
Most of Reagan's newspaper columns were ghosted for him.

definitions.text: to end a relationship with someone suddenly by stopping all communication with them
examples: Should I message her back or just ghost?
I couldn't understand why I'd been ghosted.

definitions.text: to move somewhere smoothly, quickly and quietly
examples: They slid through the big gate and ghosted across the park.
The big striker ghosted to the back post and scored.

definitions.text: the spirit of a dead person imagined as visiting the living and usually appearing as a pale, almost transparent form
examples: There are lots of stories about ghosts.
